column4: I just tried creating a usb drive according to the steps here http://www.ubuntu.com/server/get-ubuntu/download However, when I boot to the usb drive it just asks if I want to install, if I choose to install it asks me to insert the cdrom
wow, that's odd. does the live mode work?
if it does, install from within that.
there is no live option because it is the server iso
if not, i dunno
ah
shouldn't it allow you to boot to a live command line then though
there is an "advanced options" item in the list when I boot up but i have'nt tried that
u might wanna look at that, but i must admit ur out of my comfort zone with ubuntu advice, so my help stops here
i've installed server from cd and desktop from usb, but never server from usb
also, did you try unetbootin to make ur usb stick/
that's what i use - i'm not sure what those instructions say
i just checked but the advanced option only was to recover a broken  system :'(
did you make ur bootable usb with "unetbootin"?
I dont know what that is I just followed the instructions on the download site and used the universal usb installer
http://unetbootin.sourceforge.net/ <--- use this instead, it's what i use and it works every time no problems - does everything on it's own too
thanks for the link can't hurt to try something new since nothing else is workin
i love that tool, have had nothing but positive experience with it, so it ought to work for ya
awe, ubuntu server isn't in the distribution list :(
the first part is asking to download. looks neat
you still there
